title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 LOCAL PROTECTION MODELS

description.narrative: Output 2.2 (Local Protection Models): By 2020, the social sector institutions and local authorities will have operational models with which to apply comprehensive protection specialist intervention models against all forms of violence risk and humanitarian response management and local comprehensive protection monitoring systems., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 (Comprehensive Protection): By 2020, children and adolescents will have a comprehensive system for protecting their rights plus comprehensive protection and violence reduction policies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2 (Local Protection Models): By 2020, the social sector institutions and local authorities will have operational modelswith which to apply comprehensive protection; specialist intervention models against all forms of violence; risk and humanitarianresponse management; and local comprehensive protection monitoring systems.

description.narrative: In 2020, UNICEF adapted its response in protection to the consequences and impacts caused by the Covid-19 Pandemic. PCO monitored rates of violence against children and gender-based violence and produced communication messages to prevent violence. UNICEF partnered with NGOs to provide psychosocial support to children in vulnerable urban areas, including to adolescent mothers, to enhance their wellbeing and mental health. The models of protection were strengthened through capacity building for violence prevention, family strengthening and positive parenting, deinstitutionalization, supporting successful programs in psychosocial care and skills development of CSO that will inform protection policies, and advocacy in protection. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2021
